title: rustc panic in proc_macro_server with bad rust-peg grammar
body:
I made a typo in a peg rule using the `peg` crate, and the compile failed with a rustc panic.

Not sure if this is a duplicate of https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/70787 ; if so, please feel free to close in favour of that issue.

## Code

I used `peg` version `0.6.2` with the following `lib.rs`:
```rust
use peg;
peg::parser!{
    grammar test_parser() for str {
        rule num() -> u32
            = n:$(['0..='9']) { n.parse().unwrap() }
    }
}
```
I expected to get an error that `'0` wasn't terminated, but instead I got the panic shown below.

## Meta

```
>rustc --version --verbose
rustc 1.43.1 (8d69840ab 2020-05-04)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 8d69840ab92ea7f4d323420088dd8c9775f180cd
commit-date: 2020-05-04
host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
release: 1.43.1
LLVM version: 9.0
```

## Backtrace:
```
>cargo build --lib

error: lifetimes cannot start with a number
 --> src\lib.rs:5:20

5 |             = n:$(['0..='9']) { n.parse().unwrap() }
  |                    ^^
```
